alert.note: Alert for Espanola Valley; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Upper Rio Grande Valley; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 2:21PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...SNOW EXPECTED ACROSS WESTERN AND NORTH CENTRAL NEW MEXICO AGAIN TONIGHT... A storm system will move towards the Four Corners area this evening before tracking eastward across northern New Mexico through late Tuesday morning. This will bring mostly light snow to portions of western and north central New Mexico with accumulations of about 1 to 3 inches possible. A moderate band of snow may set up across across northern New Mexico tonight bringing localized higher amounts of 4 to 5 inches in the Espanola Valley and northern Sangre de Cristos. This additional round of snow may result in continued travel impacts as roads remain icy. This includes U.S. Highways 64, 68, 285, and 550. Motorists and travelers are encouraged to slow down and allow extra time to reach their destination. Winter weather conditions will clear out by late Tuesday morning. For the latest road conditions, please visit nmroads.com or dial 5-1-1.
